content.value_statement: Integrating external services and APIs into Claude Code plugins is complex. This skill provides complete guidance on MCP server configuration, authentication patterns, and tool usage for seamless external service integration.
actual_capabilities: Configure MCP servers using .mcp.json or plugin.json
Set up four server types: stdio, SSE, HTTP, and WebSocket
Implement OAuth, token-based, and environment variable authentication
Use MCP tools in commands and agents with proper pre-allowing
Apply security best practices for credentials and connections
limitations: This is documentation-only guidance, not executable code
Does not install or run MCP servers directly
Does not manage authentication tokens or credentials
Requires separate MCP server implementation for actual functionality

prompt_templates.title: Security Hardening
prompt_templates.prompt: What security best practices should I follow when deploying MCP servers in production? Cover HTTPS, token management, and tool permissions.

output_examples.input: How do I configure an HTTP MCP server with authentication?
output: Configure an HTTP server with token-based auth in .mcp.json:
Set server type to 'http' with the API endpoint URL
Add Authorization header with Bearer token from environment variable
Pre-allow specific tools in command frontmatter

best_practices: Always use HTTPS/WSS for network connections instead of HTTP/WS
Never hardcode tokens or credentials; use environment variables
Pre-allow specific MCP tools in commands, avoid wildcards for security
anti_patterns: Using wildcard tool permissions like mcp__plugin_*__* allows excessive access
Hardcoding API tokens or credentials in configuration files exposes secrets
Using HTTP instead of HTTPS transmits data insecurely

faq.question: What MCP server types are supported?
faq.answer: Four types: stdio for local processes, SSE for hosted services, HTTP for REST APIs, and WebSocket for real-time connections.

faq.question: Does this skill install MCP servers?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides documentation and configuration guidance. MCP servers must be installed and configured separately.

faq.question: How do I authenticate to MCP servers?
faq.answer: Options include OAuth for hosted SSE servers, Bearer tokens in HTTP headers, and environment variables for stdio servers.

faq.question: Is my data safe with MCP integration?
faq.answer: Security depends on configuration. Use HTTPS, environment variables for tokens, and limit tool permissions to required operations.

faq.question: Why are my MCP tools not appearing?
faq.answer: Check server configuration is valid, restart Claude Code after config changes, and verify tool names match exactly using /mcp.

faq.question: How does MCP differ from native tools?
faq.answer: MCP extends Claude Code with custom tools from external services, while native tools are built-in. MCP allows any service integration.
